a.title: Upcoming Board Meetings for VASD

div.h2: Coronavirus Updates: Schools Close Through Remainder of School Year

nav.div: Verona Area School District » News & Communications » District News » Coronavirus Updates: Schools Close Through Remainder of School Year

div.div: Coronavirus Updates: Schools Close Through Remainder of School Year

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Coronavirus Updates: Schools Close Through Remainder of School Year

span.span: Governor Evers directed Wisconsin Department of Health Services Secretary-designee Andrea Palm to extend the Safer at Home order from April 24, 2020 to 8 a.m. Tuesday, May 26, 2020, or until a superseding order is issued. That order requires Public and private K-12 schools to remain closed for pupil instruction and extracurricular activities for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Verona Area School District will continue to facilitate virtual learning.
span.br: NOTE: check out meal distribution locations/times and other resources at our regularly updated webpage:

span.span: http://www.verona.k12.wi.us/coronavirus. This page also has ALL communications being sent to families and staff, in addition to other resources.

span.style: background-color: transparent; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial;

p.span: A Verona Area School District steering committee of administration, school nurses, student services and other medical professionals has been formed to provide information and guidance for staff, students and families.
As a reminder, we are in the midst of the annual cold and flu season and precautions are always warranted. Those precautions / prevention measures include:

li.span: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. If soap and water are not available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Stay home when you are sick.
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.

strong.em: A list of useful resources can be found below. If you have any questions or concerns about your child’s health or about the flu in general, please feel free to call your school nurse as they are also listed below.

strong.span: Verona Area School District Nursing Staff

br.br:
Badger Ridge Middle School, Core Knowledge Charter School, Country View Elementary
608.845.4815
ann.juzwik@verona.k12.wi.us
